content: Heads up, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/82806 will regress compile time of a certain test case somewhat significantly, but in return it should also significantly (though hard to quantify exactly how significantly) improve runtime performance of all other rust code.
Really excited to see fewer memcpy calls.
I wonder if there's some more efficient IR we could emit for deep-vector rather than just a long series of zero stores. Maybe LLVM should have a single IR instruction for "big constant value"?
But in any case, that regression seems reasonable. As long as it's not going strongly superlinear, it seems fine.
